member.name: T:PI_Lib.PI_GET_CALL
member.summary: Summary description for PI_GET_CALL.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_GET_CALL.call_number
member.summary: Order number that is assigned by TaxiPak

summary.para: PI_DISPATCH_ACCOUNT_CALL allows a client to enter an order in TaxiPak according to the address settings for a particular account. Optionally, the client can also specify the pickup/destination address for the order rather than using the default pickup address that is stored in the account's record.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.acct_nbr
member.summary: Account number identifier. Size=16

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.fleet
member.summary: fleet identifier (A-H): Main HTD fleet is designated as Fleet H

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.call_number
member.summary: stores call number returned by the PI server. This is the unique identifier for the order within TaxiPak. Size=8

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.priority
member.summary: priority for order 1(highest priority)- 25(lowest priority). Size=2

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.number_of_calls
member.summary: how many trips to order for this account/address (1-9)

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.call_type
member.summary: combination of types of call i.e. account, multi, time call. Size=5

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.from_addr_street
member.summary: streetname of pickup address. Size=21

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.from_addr_number
member.summary: streetnumber of pickup address. Size=6

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.from_addr_suffix
member.summary: streetnumber suffix letter

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.from_addr_apart
member.summary: apartment or room number of pickup address. Size=6

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.from_addr_city
member.summary: TaxiPak abbreviation of city of pickup address (Helsinki=HEL). Size=4

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.from_addr_zone
member.summary: zone of pickup address in TaxiPak geodatabase. This field is not required but the pickup address must be 'zonable' within the TaxiPak geographic database scheme. If successful, the PI server will return the correct zone number in the reply along with the entered order number. Size=3

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.from_addr_cmnt
member.summary: pickup address comment. Size=31

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.passenger
member.summary: name of passenger. Size=21

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.requested_by
member.summary: person who made the request for the order. Size=21

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.phone
member.summary: phone number of customer. Size=11

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.to_addr_street
member.summary: streetname of destination address. Size=21

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.to_addr_number
member.summary: streetnumber of destination address. Size=6

member.summary: streetnumber suffix letter for destination

member.summary: apartment or room number of destination address. Size=6

member.summary: TaxiPak abbreviation of city of destination address

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.to_addr_zone
member.summary: zone of destination address. Size=3

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.to_addr_cmnt
member.summary: destination address comment. Size=31

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.car_number
member.summary: car number assigned to call. Size=6

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.car_attrib
member.summary: vehicle attributes for trip (Y/N)(J/N)(K/E) Size=32

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for the class.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.Deserialize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: This method will extract a confirmation call number corresponding to the database record number (CALLS table) that resulted from successful entry of the account order. Upon successful execution, the confirmation number is accessed using the call_number property of the class.
member.remarks: If the data buffer received from the PI server contains an indication of an error, an ApplicationException is thrown that should be caught by the application. The exception message will contain the specific enumeration error code.
member.param: The byte array that contains the data packet returned by the PI server.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_UPDATE_CALL.ToByteArray
member.summary: This method will take the necessary properties from the PI_DISPATCH_ACCOUNT_CALL class and pack them into a byte array in preparation for transmission to the PI server.
member.returns: Byte array formatted correctly for transmission with the PI message

member.summary: General comment field

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_DISPATCH_CALL.call_status
member.summary: Numeric value indicating the status of the order

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_DISPATCH_CALL.gpsx
member.summary: GPS position on the X axis / Longitude

member.name: F:PI_Lib.PI_DISPATCH_CALL.gpsy
member.summary: GPS position on the Y axis / Latitude

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_DISPATCH_CALL.Deserialize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: This method will extract a confirmation call number corresponding to the database record number (CALLS table) that resulted from successful entry of the order. Upon successful execution, the confirmation number is accessed using the call_number property of the class.
member.remarks: If the data buffer received from the PI server contains an indication of an error, an ApplicationException is thrown that should be caught by the application. The exception message will contain the specific enumeration error code.
member.param: The byte array that contains the data packet returned by the PI server.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_DISPATCH_CALL.ToByteArray
member.summary: This method will take the necessary properties from the PI_DISPATCH_CALL class and pack them into a byte array in preparation for transmission to the PI server.
member.returns: Byte array formatted correctly for transmission with the PI message

member.name: T:PI_Lib.PI_GET_EXCEPTS
member.summary: Summary description for PI_GET_EXCEPTS.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PIClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiates the PIClient class with a Hostname and service port. Sets the packet number to 0x00.
member.param: Hostname for the TaxiPak PI server.
Service port that TaxiPak PI server is listening to.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PIClient.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates the PIClient class without a hostname or service port. Sets the packet number to 0x01.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PIClient.IncrementPacNum
member.summary: Increments the packet number for the session. If the value exceeds 0xff, the value is rolled back to 0x00.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PIClient.SendMessage
member.summary: Send the previously formatted PI message to the TaxiPak PI server using the established TCP client socket.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PIClient.ReceiveMessage
member.summary: Receive the reply from the TaxiPak PI server.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PIClient.CloseMe
member.summary: Flushes all data on the socket and closes the socket connection.

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PIClient.PIServer
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the TaxiPak PI server as an IP address or hostname.

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PIClient.PIPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the service port upon which the TaxiPak PI server is listening for connections.

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PIClient.PacNum
member.summary: Gets or sets the packet number for the current session between the client and the server. Valid packet numbers are from 0x00 and 0xff. The TaxiPak PI server enforces that these are in sequential order.

summary.para: PI_SEND_MESSAGE class allows the client to send a text message to an individual user or group of users of the TaxiPak system.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for the class.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.Deserialize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: This method will extract a confirmation number corresponding to the database record number (MSGLOG table) that resulted from successful transmission of the message. Upon successful execution, the confirmation number is accessed using the MsgNbr property of the class.
member.remarks: If the data buffer received from the PI server contains an indication of an error, an ApplicationException is thrown that should be caught by the application. The exception message will contain the specific enumeration error code.
member.param: The byte array that contains the data packet returned by the PI server.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.ToByteArray
member.summary: This method will take the necessary properties from the PI_SEND_MESSAGE class and pack them into a byte array in preparation for transmission to the PI server.
member.returns: Byte array formatted correctly for transmission with the PI message

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.Fleet
member.summary: Gets/Sets the value for the TaxiPak fleet.

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.MsgNbr
member.summary: Used for retrieving the database record number for the message that was sent to the taxi. Setting the value has no meaning.

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.Creator
member.summary: Gets/Sets the value for the creator of the message. The TaxiPak PI server automatically sets this to 888 for messages so whatever value is set by the client will be overwritten.

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.CreationDate
member.summary: Gets/Sets the value for the date of the message creation. Since the PI server will set the date according to the system clock, doing this on the client side is not necessary.

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.CreationTime
member.summary: Gets/Sets the value for the time of the message creation. Since the PI server will set the time according to the system clock, doing this on the client side is not necessary.

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.ReceiveGroup
member.summary: Gets/Sets the value for the destination type that will be receiving the message. It is easiest to use the language specific enumerations for these. LangFinnish and LangEnglish

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.ReceiveID
member.summary: Gets/Sets the unique identifier for the receiver of the message that is being sent from the PI client.

member.name: P:PI_Lib.PI_SEND_MESSAGE.MessageText
member.summary: Gets/Sets the message text to be sent. PI enforces a length limit of 200 bytes on these messages.

member.name: T:PI_Lib.PI_CANCEL_CALL
member.summary: Summary description for PI_CANCEL_CALL.

member.name: T:PI_Lib.PI_ACCEPT_EXCEPTION
member.summary: Summary description for PI_ACCEPT_EXCEPTION.

member.name: T:PI_Lib.PI_LINE_MGR_ORDER
member.summary: Summary description for PI_LINE_MGR_ORDER.

member.name: T:PI_Lib.MessageTypes
member.summary: Supported PI message types for interacting with the TaxiPak PI server.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_UNKNOWN_ORDER
member.summary: Sent when an unknown order is received by PI

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_ZONE_ADDRESS
member.summary: Zone the incoming address delivered by the PI client

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_DISPATCH_CALL
member.summary: Dispatch the call through PI

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_CANCEL_CALL
member.summary: Cancel an existing order

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_GET_CALL
member.summary: Retrieve all the details for an existing call

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_GET_CAR
member.summary: Used to retrieve the car that is assigned to a specific call. If no car is connected to the call, the car_number field is set to zero(0)

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_GET_EXCEPTIONS
member.summary: This function finds exception of a given exception type. When using the PI_GET_EXCEPTIONS the answer will be number_of_exceptions followed by a number of EXCEPTION structures equivalent to the number of exceptions of the requested type. If there are no exceptions of the type, the number_of_exceptions is set to zero(0) and there will not be any EXCEPTION data structures

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_REPORT_EXCEPTIONS
member.summary: This function is used to tell PI to report on certain exceptions as they are generated in TaxiPak. The on_off_switch is a boolean 0x01=0n 0x00=off (CHAR size 1 byte) telling whether to report the exception or not. The 0x00 and 0x01 following PI_OK indicates whether there is an exception of the designated type in TaxiPak.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_ACCEPT_EXCEPTION
member.summary: Used to approve/disapprove an exception. Field approval is either Y/J/K=approved or N/N/E=disapproved

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_SEND_MESSAGE
member.summary: Sends a message to vehicles,drivers,users,dispatchers based on contents of the MESSAGE data structure

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_GET_MESSAGE
member.summary: Retrieves the contents of a message from the TaxiPak message table

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_ALIVE
member.summary: Function used to determine the state of PI

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_QUIT
member.summary: Function used to ask PI whether it is OK to quit the connection

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_DISP_EXT_CALL
member.summary: Dispatch an order from the FTJ/Planet system. The PI must set the FTJ/Planet order number in the ftj field (FTJ=0 non-ftj call, FTJ > 0 FTJ call)

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_GENERATE_EXCEPTION
member.summary: Generates exceptions that are specific to the Samplan system (FTJ). Exception class = 1 (Samplan) with exception type in the range 29-43

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_DISPATCH_ACCOUNT_CALL
member.summary: Generate an order in TaxiPak based on the address/passenger details associated with the provided account number.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_ZONE_INFO
member.summary: Used to get zone information from the TaxiPak system. Client queries TaxiPak based on fleet, zone number, and attributes and is returned information on number of trips, vehicles etc.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_PRE_BOOK_INFO
member.summary: Retrieves information on the availability of a time call booking for a given fleet, zone, and date

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_LINE_MGR_ORDER
member.summary: Provides interface for caller identification and callback order requests

member.name: F:PI_Lib.MessageTypes.PI_RQST_GPS
member.summary: Client requests a GPS polling message sent to the requested taxi

member.name: T:PI_Lib.StatusTypes
member.summary: 1 = PENDING 2 = UNASSIGNED 3 = ASSIGNED 4 = PICKUP 5 = COMPLETE 6 = CANCELLED

member.name: F:PI_Lib.StatusTypes.ODOTTAA
member.summary: PENDING

member.name: F:PI_Lib.StatusTypes.AVOIN
member.summary: UNASSIGNED

member.name: F:PI_Lib.StatusTypes.VLITETTY
member.summary: ASSIGNED

member.name: F:PI_Lib.StatusTypes.NOUTO
member.summary: PICKUP

member.name: F:PI_Lib.StatusTypes.VALMIS
member.summary: COMPLETE

member.name: F:PI_Lib.StatusTypes.PERUTTUS
member.summary: CANCELLED

member.name: F:PI_Lib.StatusTypes.NOEXIST
member.summary: NON EXISTENT STATUS

member.name: T:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes
member.summary: Enumeration of all the possible codes returned by the PI server when a request is made by the client.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_OK
member.summary: No failure Applies to all message types

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_LEN
member.summary: The data block has an illegal length Applies to all message types

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_VALUE
member.summary: Unable to get values from the data-block Applies to all message types

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_FLEET
member.summary: Fleet is outside the range A-H Applies to all message types

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_DB_OP_FAIL
member.summary: database operation fails closing down Applies to all message types

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_PRIO
member.summary: trips priority is outside 6-63 Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_VEH
member.summary: # of vehicles not within 1-9 Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_CALL_1
member.summary: incorrect call type:Pass,Deliv,Extra,Wakeup Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_CALL_2
member.summary: incorrect call-type: Autobooker Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_CALL_3
member.summary: incorrect call-type: Timecall, subscription Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_CALL_4
member.summary: incorrect call-type: Charge Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_CALL_5
member.summary: incorrect call-type: Multi Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_ADDR_STR
member.summary: invalid streetname Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_ADDR_NUM
member.summary: invalid street number Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_CITY
member.summary: invalid city abbreviation Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_VEH_ATTRIB
member.summary: one of the vehicle attributes does not match Y/N Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_DRV_ATTRIB
member.summary: one of the driver attributes does not match Y/N Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_DUE_TIME
member.summary: due time for future call is too old Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_ZONE
member.summary: pickup zone is not valid Applies to PI_ZONE_ADDRESS and PI_DISPATCH_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_NO_CALL
member.summary: Call does not exist Applies to PI_CANCEL_CALL, PI_GET_CALL, and PI_GET_CAR

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_EXCEPTION_TYPE
member.summary: exception-type does not exist Applies to PI_GET_EXCEPTIONS

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_EXCEPTION_MSG
member.summary: exception-message-number is not valid Applies to PI_GET_EXCEPTIONS

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_EXCEPTION
member.summary: exception does not exist Applies to PI_ACCEPT_EXCEPTION

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_APPROVAL
member.summary: incorrect approval type (Y/N) Applies to PI_ACCEPT_EXCEPTION

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_GROUP
member.summary: receiver-group doesnt exist Applies to PI_SEND_MESSAGE

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_RECEIVER
member.summary: receiver doesnt exist Applies to PI_SEND_MESSAGE

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_NOT_RECEIVED
member.summary: message was not received Applies to PI_SEND_MESSAGE

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INVALID_MMP_CHAR
member.summary: range 0x20 to 0x5F is violated for MMP message Applies to PI_SEND_MESSAGE

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INV_EXCP_GROUP
member.summary: group not defined (1=valid) Applies to PI_GENERATE_EXCEPTION

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INV_EXCP_NBR
member.summary: exception number not in range Applies to PI_GENERATE_EXCEPTION

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INV_OFFER_TYPE
member.summary: not in range (1-10) Applies to PI_DISPATCH_EXT_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INV_DETAIL_TYPE
member.summary: not in range (1-10) Applies to PI_DISPATCH_EXT_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INV_NBR_CALL_MSGS
member.summary: not in range (0-3) Applies to PI_DISPATCH_EXT_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INV_FTJ_NBR
member.summary: not in range (0-MAXINT) Applies to PI_DISPATCH_EXT_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INV_CMSG_DEVICE
member.summary: not in range (0-2) Applies to PI_DISPATCH_EXT_CALL

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ErrorCodes.PI_INV_CMSG_MULTI_NUM
member.summary: multi-call # (1-3) Applies to PI_DISPATCH_EXT_CALL

member.name: T:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes
member.summary: Defined TaxiPak exception types.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.EMERGENCY
member.summary: driver pushed the alarm button

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.CALL_CANCEL
member.summary: request to cancel a call

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.UNZONED
member.summary: call cannot be zoned by TaxiPak

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.EXTRA_TAXIS
member.summary: more taxis required than 9

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.CALLBACK
member.summary: customer has called back to call center requesting status of trip

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.CALL_TIMEOUT
member.summary: call has not been assigned before timer expiration

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.LATE_METER
member.summary: taxi is late in arrival to customer

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.FLAG_REQ
member.summary: driver wants to pickup a customer on the street

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.NO_SHOW
member.summary: customer was not available for pickup

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.CALLOUT
member.summary: call the customer and inform that taxi has arrived

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.REQ_TO_TALK
member.summary: driver has requested to talk on voice channel

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.ETA
member.summary: estimated time of arrival as reported by driver

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.MESSAGE
member.summary: driver has sent a predefined message

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.BID
member.summary: No longer supported.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.DRV_MSG
member.summary: call center user wants to send a message to a driver/vehicle

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.WAKE_UP
member.summary: a customer requires a 'wake-up' call

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.SHORT_METER
member.summary: taximeter has been on for too short a period

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.HOL_TM_CALL
member.summary: alert that a subscription time call was generated on a day that is a designated holiday.

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.SYS_ERR
member.summary: any type of system malfunction (ACC,filesystem full etc)

member.name: F:PI_Lib.ExceptionTypes.METER_FAULT
member.summary: MDT generates meter fault message

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_ZONE_ADDRESS.Deserialize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: This method will extract a confirmation call number corresponding to the database record number (CALLS table) that resulted from successful entry of the order. Upon successful execution, the confirmation number is accessed using the call_number property of the class.
member.remarks: If the data buffer received from the PI server contains an indication of an error, an ApplicationException is thrown that should be caught by the application. The exception message will contain the specific enumeration error code.
member.param: The byte array that contains the data packet returned by the PI server.

member.name: M:PI_Lib.PI_ZONE_ADDRESS.ToByteArray
member.summary: This method will take the necessary properties from the PI_DISPATCH_CALL class and pack them into a byte array in preparation for transmission to the PI server.
member.returns: Byte array formatted correctly for transmission with the PI message
